I don't have experience using NTLM for authentications.  Could it have 
anything to do with fact that Heritrix doesn't do keep-alives?  (From 
the httpclient auth page "... or can NTLM be used with HTTP 1.0 
connections or servers that do not support HTTP keep-alives."  See 
http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/httpclient/authentication.html#Proxy_Authentication).  
Can you get access to the server logs?  Perhaps they'll yield clues on 
what the client is failing to supply?

St.Ack


tintangsg wrote:
>
> Hi,
> I'm desperately looking for a solution to my proxy problem, could you
> pls help?
>
> I am using Heritrix in my "focused" Web crawler application. However,
> my company uses proxy authentication (NTLM scheme) so I got connection
> refused problem.
>
> I've attempted to add the following: Put the proxy IP address, port,
> network user name and password in the order.xml file. These are then
> read by the FetchHTTP processor. In the innerProcess() method of this
> processor, I do the following:
>
> NTCredentials ntCredentials = new NTCredentials(login, pwd,
> myComputerName, domain);
> //where login and pwd are my network login and pwd taken from order.xml
> //myComputerName and domain are obtained from My Computer's
> Properties. I've tried both short name for the computername and
> fullname (including the domain)
>
> AuthScope authscope = new AuthScope( host, Integer.parseInt(port),
> null, "ntlm");
> //is null correct for realm here? I also tried to use domain instead
> of null but no luck
> //where host and port are taken from order.xml
> //then set proxy credentials
> this.http.getState().setProxyCredentials( authscope, ntCredentials);
>
> I then setDoAuthentication() to true.
>
> When running the application, I receive the following error:
> Failure authenticating with NTLM <any realm>@....x.x:xxxx
> Nov 23, 2006 5:37:30 PM org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP
> innerProcess
> INFO: GET http://www.abc.edu/ <http://www.abc.edu/> 407 4515 text/html
>
> --------
> The "407" status code means proxy authentication required. And the
> HTML page I received contains:
> The ISA Server requires authorization to fulfill the request. Access
> to the Web Proxy filter is denied. )Via: 1.1 PROXY1Proxy-
> Authenticate: NegotiateProxy-Authenticate: KerberosProxy-Authenticate:
> NTLM
> ---------
> Pls give me your suggestions on what I may have done wrong here?
> Any idea is highly appreciated!
>
